meanings.definition: To bind or compel someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The teacher was obligating the students to complete their homework on time.
meanings.sent2: She is obligating her brother to help with the household chores.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf was obligating the cookies to jump into his mouth.
meanings.sent4: The contract was obligating him like chains, restricting his freedom.
meanings.sent5: The judge's stern gaze was obligating the witness to tell the truth.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel morally or legally bound to do something
meanings.sent1: The promise he made was obligating him to keep his word.
meanings.sent2: The law obligates citizens to pay their taxes on time.
meanings.sent3: The talking parrot was obligating the cat to confess its love for tuna.
meanings.sent4: Her conscience was obligating her to apologize for her mistake.
meanings.sent5: The oath taken by knights was obligating them to protect the kingdom at all costs.
